org.hps.analysis.trigger

Class DataTriggerSim2019Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.analysis.trigger.DataTriggerSim2019Driver

  • public class DataTriggerSim2019Driver
extends Driver
    Class DataTriggerSim2019Driver takes in clusters of both class Cluster and VTPCluster and hodoscope hits of class CalorimeterHit and performs a simulation of the hardware trigger on them. The results of this simulation are then stored in a SimTriggerData2019 object which is placed on the data stream to allow for other drivers to access the trigger results.

    DataTriggerSim2019Driver is intended exclusively as a hardware simulation, and as such, requires that the DAQ configuration is read before it can function. Thusly, DAQConfig2019Driver must exist upstream of this driver for it to initialize. Additionally, to ensure consistency with data, it is advised that online FADC driver be employed and the VTP clustering driver be set to draw from the DAQ configuration as well.

    DataTriggerSim2019Driver requires two input collections. The first is the bank collection, which contains the VTP banks. It uses the VTP bank to obtain hardware clusters. It also requires the reconstructed cluster bank to obtain the clusters that are simulated from FADC hits. The driver outputs one collection, the simulated trigger collection, which contains simulated triggers. This collection consists of one SimTriggerData2019 object that can be accessed to obtain all simulated trigger types. This output object is not persisted into LCIO after runtime. Class DataTriggerSim2019Driver is developed based on Class DataTriggerSimDriver
    See Also:
    org.hps.record.daqconfig.DAQConfig2019Driver, EcalOnlineRawConverter2019Driver, VTPOnlineCluster2019Driver, SimTriggerData2019

    • Method Detail

      • startOfData

        public void startOfData()
        Connects the driver to the the ConfigurationManager2019 in order to obtain the correct trigger information. Trigger settings are stored in the TriggerModule2019 objects.
        Overrides:
        startOfData in class Driver

      • process

        public void process(EventHeader event)
        Processes an LCIO event and simulates triggers in the same manner as the hardware for both VTPCluster objects as well as Cluster objects reconstructed from FADC hits. Triggers are then output to the data stream.
        Overrides:
        process in class Driver
        Parameters:
        event - - The EventHeader object representing the current LCIO event.

      • constructTriggers

        private <E> SimTriggerModule2019<E> constructTriggers(List<E> clusters,
                                                      Class<E> clusterType,
                                                      List<CalorimeterHit> hodoHits)
                                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs simulated triggers in the same manner as the hardware. Method can accept either Cluster objects, any object that is a subclass of Cluster, or objects of type VTPCluster.
        Parameters:
        clusters - - A List collection of the cluster objects from which triggers are to be derived.
        clusterType - - The class of the cluster objects from which triggers are to be derived. This can be Cluster, VTPCluster, or a subclass thereof.
        Returns:
        Returns a SimTriggerModule2019 object containing the simulated trigger results.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the class of the cluster objects is not of a supported type.

      • setFilterUnverifiableClusters

        public void setFilterUnverifiableClusters(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not triggers should be formed using all clusters, or only those that where the integration window for the cluster is completely within the bounds of the event window.
        Parameters:
        state - - true means that only clusters where the entire cluster integration window is within the event time window will be used, while false means that all clusters will be used.

      • setTriggerCollectionName

        public void setTriggerCollectionName(String triggerCollection)
        Sets the name of the LCIO collection containing simulated triggers.
        Parameters:
        triggerCollection - - The trigger collection name.

      • getTriggerTime

        private static final double getTriggerTime(Trigger<?> trigger)
        Gets the trigger time of an arbitrary trigger, so long as its source is either a Cluster or VTPCluster object. Method also supports pairs of these objects as a size two array. For pairs trigger of 2019 experiment, time of the earliest cluster is set as time of trigger
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger time of the trigger as a double.

      • getRunNumber

        public final int getRunNumber()
        Gets the run number that the DAQConfigDriver is set to use. This will be -1 in the event that the driver reads from an EvIO file.
        Returns:
        Returns the run number as an int primitive. Will return -1 if the driver is set to read from an EvIO file.
